Legal_Issue: Whether allegations about refusal to settle and procedural history are permissible in pleadings
Application_Facts: Rothmans included allegations about Imperial's refusal to negotiate settlement and procedural history in their Statement of Defence; Imperial moved to strike those parts
Decision_Outcome: Second and last sentences of paragraph five remain; third and fourth sentences struck
Remedy_Requested: Imperial requested striking irrelevant portions of Rothmans' Statement of Defence
Court_Ruling: Parts of the pleading not relevant to patent validity or infringement were struck
Defendant_Behavior: Rothmans included allegations regarding settlement refusal and procedural matters
Grounds_for_Claim: Pleadings must be relevant to patent validity and infringement
Legal_Standard: Pleadings must be relevant to the lis and directly connected to the issues in dispute
Assessment_Factor: Relevance of allegations to core issues of patent validity and infringement
Procedural_Issue: Allegations about consolidation and settlement negotiations in pleadings
Application_Basis: Rules of pleading in patent disputes
Relief_Sought: Striking improper allegations from the Statement of Defence
Governing_Rule: Pleadings must be relevant to the issues of patent validity and infringement
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Allegations of motive and procedural conduct not supported by proper evidentiary context in pleadings
Outcome: Partial success for Imperialâ€”irrelevant allegations struck
Cause_Description: Imperial sought declaration of patent invalidity or non-infringement after threat of legal action from Rothmans
Decision_Rationale: Allegations about refusal to settle are not part of the lis unless directly connected to validity or infringement
Legal_Standard_Applied: Relevance and connection of pleadings to core legal issues in patent disputes
